page.title: 18EAST LEAKE TUG-OF-WAR
page.content: For one evening in the Summer the Village Green is taken over by East Leake Bantams Football Club who organise a Tug-of-War competition.A wide brook runs through the green which is opposite St.Mary's Church and teams pull across it,the losers getting a soaking. The evening commences with a Grand Procession of floats containing members of clubs and societies in fancy dress.Traffic in the village now comes to a virtual standstill as hundreds of people view the procession which finishes at the village green. There are stalls of all kinds:-games,food etc.and people flock from all around to join in the fun. The local public house,The Three Horseshoes(the original building was the village smithy)does a roaring trade.
